means: [地名] [加拿大、美国] 利伯蒂

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"自由"之意。
means: freedom ： 含义广，指任何无限制无束缚的自由自在状态。
liberty ： 常可与freedom换用，但强调从过去受的压制、管束下被解救或释放出来，也指法律所承认的特权，如言论、集会等自由。

sentence.Network_en: He firmly believes liberty is inseparable from social justice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他坚信自由与社会正义是不可分的。

sentence.Network_en: I am afraid we are not at liberty to disclose that information.
sentence.Network_cn: 恐怕我们无权透露这一信息。

sentence.Network_en: The Puritans became fugitives in quest of liberty.
sentence.Network_cn: 清教徒变成了追求自由的逃亡者。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 最有意义的英语单词 - no的日志 - 网易博客 ... 8.freedom 自由 9.liberty 自由 10.tranquility 宁静.
Liberty_百度百科 ... take the liberty to do sth. 冒昧行事 liberty n. 自由; 自由权 civil liberty 法律规定的(公民)自由权.
复合式听写高频词汇_百度文库 ... legal a. 法律的；合法的 liberty n. 自由；释放；许可 loyalty n. 忠诚，忠心.

list.abs: “自由钟”（Liberty Bell）是美国费城国家独立历史公园里的一件珍贵文物。在美国发行的铸币上，曾两次出现“自由钟”的图案，1948年 …
公民自由（Civil Liberties）往往指公民的政治自由。公民自由限制了政府的权力，防止政府滥用权力和干扰其公民的生活。
478 论自由（ON LIBERTY），By （英）J．S．密尔（John Stuart Mill）479 法官和他的刽子手，By （瑞士）弗·迪伦马特480 政府 …
自由岛（liberty island）(Liberty Island )，亦称自由女神岛，旧称白德路岛(Bedloe's Island, 1956年以前)。 美国纽约市一岛屿，在上纽约湾内，隔水与 …

jx.jx_en_mean: behave in an unduly familiar manner towards a person

lj.lj_ly: you've taken too many liberties with me.

jx.jx_en_mean: treat something freely, without strict faithfulness to the facts or to an original

lj.lj_ly: the scriptwriter has taken few liberties with the original narrative.
lj.lj_ls: 剧本作者对原作故事仅作了个别的自由处理。

jx.jx_en_mean: venture to do something without first asking permission

lj.lj_ly: I have taken the liberty of submitting an idea to several of their research departments.
lj.lj_ls: 我已自作主张地向他们的几个研究部门提出了一个想法。

jx.jx_en_mean: Not in confinement or under constraint; free.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 自由：不受约束的或不受限制的；自由的

jx.jx_en_mean: Not employed, occupied, or in use.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 空闲的，不占用的或不被使用的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French liberte, from Latin libertas, from liber 'free'

entry.def: Liberty is the freedom to live your life in the way that you want, without interference from other people or the authorities.

example.ex: Wit Wolzek claimed the legislation could impinge on privacy, self determination and respect for religious liberty...
example.tran: 威特·沃尔泽克声称这项法律可能会对隐私权和自主权造成侵犯，并破坏对宗教自由的尊重。

example.ex: Such a system would be a fundamental blow to the rights and liberties of the English people.
example.tran: 这样一种制度将对英国人民的权利与自由造成根本性的打击。

entry.def: Liberty is the freedom to go wherever you want, which you lose when you are a prisoner.

example.ex: Why not say that three convictions before court for stealing cars means three months' loss of liberty...
example.tran: 为什么不说被判3项偷车罪名就意味着丧失3个月的人身自由呢？

example.ex: There is no formal confirmation so far that he is at liberty.
example.tran: 目前还没有正式确认他已经获得人身自由。

entry.def: If someone is at liberty to do something, they have been given permission to do it.

example.ex: The island's in the Pacific Ocean; I'm  not at liberty to say exactly where, because  we're still negotiating for its purchase.
example.tran: 这个岛在太平洋上；我无权说出它的具体位置，因为我们仍在洽谈购买事宜。

entry.def: If you say that you have taken the liberty of doing something, you are saying that you have done it without asking permission. People say this when they do not think that anyone will mind what they have done.

example.ex: I took the liberty of going into Assunta's wardrobe, as it was open; I was looking for a towel.
example.tran: 阿孙塔的衣橱敞着，我便擅自在里面翻了一下。我想找一条毛巾。

entry.tran: （对某人）过分亲昵，表现无礼；（对某事物）过于随便
entry.def: If you take liberties or take a liberty with someone or something, you act in a way that is too free and does not show enough respect.

example.ex: Try and retain the excitement of the event in your writing, without taking liberties with the truth...
example.tran: 请尽量在文字中再现活动的热烈气氛，但不要对事实添油加醋，任意窜改。

example.ex: She knew she was taking a big liberty in developing Mick's photos without his knowledge.
example.tran: 她知道没告诉米克就擅自冲洗他的照片是太过放肆了。

means.word_mean: 1. immunity from arbitrary exercise of authority: political independence

sentences.sentence: "liberty--perfect liberty--to think or feel or do just as one pleases"
"at liberty to choose whatever occupation one wishes"

means.word_mean: 3. personal freedom from servitude or confinement or oppression
4. leave granted to a sailor or naval officer

auth_sentence.content: This is equally harmful to liberty and dual sovereignty.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is equally harmful to liberty and dual sovereignty.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is equally harmful to liberty and dual sovereignty.

auth_sentence.content: She liked her baby to have...liberty to roll around.
auth_sentence.res_content: She liked her baby to have...liberty to roll around.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She liked her baby to have...liberty to roll around.

auth_sentence.content: The working-class ideology...put an exceptionally high value upon...personal liberty.
auth_sentence.res_content: The working-class ideology...put an exceptionally high value upon...personal liberty.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The working-class ideology...put an exceptionally high value upon...personal liberty.

stems_affixes.word_buile: il不+liberal宽大的→不宽大的→吝啬的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 慷慨的,大方的;富足的;自由的,思想开放的
stems_affixes.word_buile: liber自由+al……的→adj.慷慨的,大方的;富足的;自由的,思想开放的
liber自由+t+ine人→自由之人→浪荡子
liber自由+ty表名词→n.自由,自由权;特权

sentences.en: The constitution guards the liberty of people.
The constitution guards the liberty of people.
He granted the boy liberty to go out.

jushi.english: The constitute guards the liberty of people.
The tyrant's oppressed subjects cry out for their liberty.
jushi.chinese: 被暴君压迫的臣民们呼吁自由。

jushi.english: He granted the boy liberty to go out.
